snippet.textDisplay: It's interesting how Metroid Prime truly transferred the Metroid saga into 3D flawlessly...I mean, when you play Super Metroid and Metroid Prime, they practically feel like the same gameplay style, just one in 2D and the other one in 3D.
snippet.textOriginal: It's interesting how Metroid Prime truly transferred the Metroid saga into 3D flawlessly...I mean, when you play Super Metroid and Metroid Prime, they practically feel like the same gameplay style, just one in 2D and the other one in 3D.

snippet.textDisplay: Nintendo's very good at that. While all the other companies were freaking out about bringing their games into 3D, Nintendo just kinda came out at them with Ocarina of Time and Super Mario 64 like it wasn't even a problem. Metroid was a late bloomer, but I think it was worth it - I'd definitely agree about the flawless transfer.
snippet.textOriginal: Nintendo's very good at that. While all the other companies were freaking out about bringing their games into 3D, Nintendo just kinda came out at them with Ocarina of Time and Super Mario 64 like it wasn't even a problem. Metroid was a late bloomer, but I think it was worth it - I'd definitely agree about the flawless transfer.

snippet.textDisplay: This game was so cohesive and ahead of its time. When so many games were trying to be movies, linear, and objective based, this game told a cryptic story you had to discover, had immersive environments, privileged discovery, and frankly did stuff right that a lot of big budget games still get wrong.
snippet.textOriginal: This game was so cohesive and ahead of its time. When so many games were trying to be movies, linear, and objective based, this game told a cryptic story you had to discover, had immersive environments, privileged discovery, and frankly did stuff right that a lot of big budget games still get wrong.

snippet.textDisplay: Halo 1 & 2 have one the best best BEST campaigns/story.  Metroid Prime, Echoes, and Corruption are great games (Prime 1 and 2 higher than 3).  Both Halo and Metroid Prime's plot/story is flawed at times, but Prime's gameplay is so phenomenal, detective-like, and mysterious. They are both "objective-based" at times, moreso with Halo, I think. Halo's story is also mysterious. They both have great plots that run deep with mystery and intrigue. Big fan of Xbox (original-NOT 360) & gamecube.
snippet.textOriginal: Halo 1 & 2 have one the best best BEST campaigns/story.  Metroid Prime, Echoes, and Corruption are great games (Prime 1 and 2 higher than 3).  Both Halo and Metroid Prime's plot/story is flawed at times, but Prime's gameplay is so phenomenal, detective-like, and mysterious. They are both "objective-based" at times, moreso with Halo, I think. Halo's story is also mysterious. They both have great plots that run deep with mystery and intrigue. Big fan of Xbox (original-NOT 360) & gamecube.

snippet.textDisplay: I am a huge Metroid fan and never played a Halo game (I don't even own an xbox), but I can still  tell that you have no idea what you're talking about. Halo has some of the deepest plots in video gaming. From what I understand, one game's plot is more complex than all of the Metroid series put together. (though that might be an exaggeration). Also, you seem to be confusing it with the Call of Duty and Battlefield series. It's a singleplayer game at heart.
snippet.textOriginal: I am a huge Metroid fan and never played a Halo game (I don't even own an xbox), but I can still  tell that you have no idea what you're talking about. snippet.textDisplay: by far my all time favourite and most memorable piece from any game, when i first played the original, an ice landscape so well realised as this one was with this music really had me in aw (it got better and better as the game/s went on aswell :P
snippet.textOriginal: by far my all time favourite and most memorable piece from any game, when i first played the original, an ice landscape so well realised as this one was with this music really had me in aw (it got better and better as the game/s went on aswell :P

snippet.textDisplay: @IntuitionJo I preferred the 2D Metroid games, personally.  That being said, I still found the Prime games to be amazing - it says a lot for a game when it can grab you in even through your own skepticism.  They may not be on Super Metroid's level (at least not in my opinion), but they dwarfed every other type of action/exploration game of the past console generation by far!
snippet.textOriginal: @IntuitionJo I preferred the 2D Metroid games, personally.  That being said, I still found the Prime games to be amazing - it says a lot for a game when it can grab you in even through your own skepticism.  They may not be on Super Metroid's level (at least not in my opinion), but they dwarfed every other type of action/exploration game of the past console generation by far!

snippet.textDisplay: When my older brother told me to buy this game, I thought he was nuts but when I began playing, I couldn't believe my eyes. The graphics were so beautiful, the atmosphere was perfect, the music wrapped around my heart and squeezed out my emotions. Metroid Prime 1, in my opinion, the best Metriod Prime out of the trilogy

snippet.textDisplay: @TheGoldenMushroom One thing I noticed is that although Xbox and PS3 games may have better gameplay, graphics, and effects. Nintendo will always be the master of emerging you into the game's universe with the aesthetic music, environments, and deep story. Metroid Prime and the Legend of Zelda games do this very well.
snippet.textOriginal: @TheGoldenMushroom One thing I noticed is that although Xbox and PS3 games may have better gameplay, graphics, and effects. snippet.textDisplay: the build up is the best part of this song. the climax of it on its own isn't that great, but when it is paired with a peaceful, subtle buildup, the climax of the song is absolutely incredible. the best part is that if the climax were any stronger, it would detract from the song because it just wouldn't fit the buildup.
snippet.textOriginal: the build up is the best part of this song. the climax of it on its own isn't that great, but when it is paired with a peaceful, subtle buildup, the climax of the song is absolutely incredible. the best part is that if the climax were any stronger, it would detract from the song because it just wouldn't fit the buildup.

snippet.textOriginal: Majora's Mask does kick ass, though.

snippet.textDisplay:
@IntuitionJo 

I must disagree.  Prime 1 had the history, openness, atmosphere, puzzles, action and story; Prime 2, while not nearly as good as the first, had good puzzles and an odd appeal unlike that of any game I've ever played; and Prime 3 was a steaming pile of shit with not a single redeeming quality.  1 > 2 > 3
snippet.textOriginal:
@IntuitionJo 

I must disagree.  Prime 1 had the history, openness, atmosphere, puzzles, action and story; Prime 2, while not nearly as good as the first, had good puzzles and an odd appeal unlike that of any game I've ever played; and Prime 3 was a steaming pile of shit with not a single redeeming quality.  1 > 2 > 3

snippet.textDisplay:
I am disappointed by that. Metroid Prime's 2 and 3 are to Metroid Prime 1 what Majora's Mask is to Ocarina of time. They compliment each other, filling in the gaps that the others didn't. Prime 1 had the history and the openness, Prime 2 had the atmosphere and the puzzles, and Prime 3 had the action and the story. Don't go saying any of them are inferior to one another, because they all kick ass.

...Ok, I'm done.
snippet.textOriginal:
I am disappointed by that. Metroid Prime's 2 and 3 are to Metroid Prime 1 what Majora's Mask is to Ocarina of time. They compliment each other, filling in the gaps that the others didn't. Prime 1 had the history and the openness, Prime 2 had the atmosphere and the puzzles, and Prime 3 had the action and the story. Don't go saying any of them are inferior to one another, because they all kick ass.

...Ok, I'm done.
